1   And Job again took up her parable, and said: 2 As God liveth, who hath taken away my right; and the Almighty, who hath dealt bitterly with me; 3 All the while my breath is in me, and the spirit of God is in my nostrils, 4 Surely my lips shall not speak unrighteousness, neither shall my tongue utter deceit; 5 Far be it from me that I should justify you;
till I die I will not put away mine integrity from me. 6 My righteousness I hold fast, and will not let it go; my heart shall not reproach me so long as I live. 7 Let mine enemy be as the wicked, and let her that riseth up against me be as the unrighteous. 8 For what is the hope of the godless, though she get her gain, when God taketh away her soul? 9 Will God hear her cry, when trouble cometh upon her? 10 Will she have her delight in the Almighty, and call upon God at all times? 11 I will teach you concerning the hand of God; that which is with the Almighty will I not conceal.
12 Behold, all ye yourselves have seen it; why then are ye become altogether vain? 13 This is the portion of a wicked woman with God, and the heritage of oppressors, which they receive from the Almighty. 14 If her children be multiplied, it is for the sword; and her offspring shall not have bread enough. 15 Those that remain of her shall be buried by pestilence, and her widows shall make no lamentation. 16 Though she heap up silver as the dust, and prepare raiment as the clay; 17 She may prepare it, but the just shall put it on, and the innocent shall divide the silver. 18 She buildeth her house as a moth, and as a booth which the keeper maketh. 19 She lieth down rich, but there shall be nought to gather; she openeth her eyes, and her wealth is not. 20 Terrors overtake her like waters; a tempest stealeth her away in the night. 21 The east wind carrieth her away, and she departeth; and it sweepeth her out of her place. 22 Yea, it hurleth at her, and spareth not; she would fain flee from its power.
